intro: Sorocea sprucei subsp. sprucei, commonly known as the spruceleaf sorocea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Its botanical features include leathery leaves and a compact growth habit, making it well adapted to its ecological niche. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
